translated: Ai. Salutations to Rati Matangi at the base of the spine. Klim. Salutations to Dhriti Matangini at the heart.

original: hrī/ prīti mātaṃginyai namaḥ bhrūmadhya / iti vinyasya śakti nyāsa kuryāt /🔽ai/ hrī/ śrī/ hṛllekhā mātaṃginyai namaḥ śirasmi / gaganamātaṃginyai
analyzed: hrī prīti mātaṃginyai namaḥ bhrūmadhye iti vinyasya śakti nyāsa kuryāt  ai hrī śrī hṛllekhā mātaṃginyai namaḥ gaganamātaṃginyai
translated: Hrim. Salutations to Priti Matangini between the eyebrows. Having assigned thus, one should perform the Shakti Nyasa.🔽Ai. Hrim. Shrim. Salutations to Hridaya Matangini with Hridaya. Salutations to Gaganamatangini with Gaganamatangini.

original: namaḥ mukhe / raktamātaṃginyai namaḥ hṛdi / karālinī mātaṃginyai
analyzed: namaḥ mukhe   raktamātaṃginyai namaḥ hṛdi   karālinī mātaṃginyai
translated: Salutations to Raktamatangini at the heart. Salutations to Karalini Matangini

original: namaḥ guhye / mahochuṣmā mātaṃginyai namaḥ pādayo /
analyzed: namaḥ guhye mātaṃginyai namaḥ
translated: at the secret place. Salutations to Mahochhusha Matangini at the feet.

analyzed: iti vinyasya vāṇa nyāsam kuryāt
translated: Having assigned thus, one should perform the Vana Nyasa.

original: oṃ hrā/ drāviṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ śirasi / oṃ saṃ śoṣaṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ🔽mukhe / oṃ va/ vandhanī mātaṃginyai namaḥ hṛdi / oṃ maṃ mohini mātaṃgyai
analyzed: om hrā drāviṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ śirasi om saṃ śoṣaṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ  mukhe om va vandhanī mātaṃginyai namaḥ hṛdi om maṃ mohini mātaṃgyai
translated: Om Hram. Salutations to Dravini Matangi at the head. Om Sam. Salutations to Shoshini Matangi at the🔽face. Om Va. Salutations to Bandhani Matangini at the heart. Om Mam. Salutations to Mohini Matangi

original: namaḥ guhye / oṃ ā/ ākarṣaṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ pādayo /
analyzed: namaḥ guhye om ā ākarṣaṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ
translated: at the secret place. Om A. Salutations to Akarshini Matangi at the feet.

analyzed: iti vinyasya kāmakalā nyāsam kuryāt
translated: Having assigned thus, one should perform the Kamakala Nyasa.

original: ai/ hrī/ śrī/ manmathamātaṃgyai namaḥ śirasi /
analyzed: ai hrī śrī manmathamātaṃgyai namaḥ śirasi
translated: Ai. Hrim. Shrim. Salutations to Manmatha Matangi at the head.

original: ai/ hrī/ śrī/ makaradhvajamātaṃgyai namaḥ mukhe / ai/ hrī/ śrī/
analyzed: ai hrī śrī makaradhvaja mātaṃgyai namaḥ mukhe ai hrī śrī
translated: Ai. Hri. Shri. Salutations to the face of Makaradhvaja Matangi. Ai. Hri. Shri.

analyzed: mada mātaṃgau namaḥ dakṣiṇa skande puṣpadhanuḥ mātaṃgyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the right side of Madama Tangau. Salutations to the right side of Pushpadhanur Matangi.

original: dakṣapārśve / puṣpāyudhamātaṃgyai namaḥ nābhau /🔽kaṃdarpamātaṃgyai namaḥ vāmaskande / manobhavamātaṃgyai namaḥ
analyzed: dakṣa pārśve puṣpāyudha mātaṃgyai namaḥ nābhau  kaṃdarpa mātaṃgyai namaḥ vāma skande manobhava mātaṃgyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the navel of Pushpayudha Matangi.🔽Salutations to the left side of Kandarpamatangi. Salutations to the left side of Manobhava Matangi.

analyzed: vāma pārśve ratipriyā mātaṃgyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the feet of Ratipriya Matangi.

original: iti vinyasya cakranyāsaṃ kuryāt /🔽oṃ klī/ anaṅgakusumamātaṃgyai namaḥ mūlādhāre /
analyzed: iti vinyasya cakra nyāsam kuryāt  om klī anaṅga kusuma mātaṃgyai namaḥ mūlādhāre
translated: Having assigned this, one should perform the cakra nyasa.🔽Om Klim. Salutations to Anangakusuma Matangi in the root chakra.

original: anaṃgamekhalāmātaṃgai namaḥ svādhiṣṭāne /🔽anaṅgamadanā mātaṃgyai namaḥ maṇipūre /
analyzed: anaṃga mekhalā mātaṃgai namaḥ svādhiṣṭāne  anaṅga madanā mātaṃgyai namaḥ maṇipūre  /
translated: Salutations to Anangamekhalā Matangi in the svādhiṣṭhāna.🔽Salutations to Anangamadanā Matangi in the maṇipūra.

original: anegarūpiṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ anāhate /🔽anaṃgavegā mātaṃgyai namaḥ viśuddhe /
analyzed: anegarūpiṇī mātaṃgyai namaḥ anāhate  anaṃgavegā mātaṃgyai namaḥ viśuddhe
translated: Salutations to Anangarūpiṇī Matangi in the anāhata.🔽Salutations to Anangavegā Matangi in the viśuddha.

original: anaṃgasaṃbhavā mātaṃginyai namaḥ ākāśe /🔽anaṃgapālinī mātaṃginyai namaḥ / ājñācakre /
analyzed: anaṃgasaṃbhavā mātaṃginyai namaḥ ākāśe  anaṃgapālinī mātaṃginyai namaḥ ājñācakre
translated: Salutations to Anangasaṃbhavā Matangi in the ākāśa.🔽Salutations to Anangapālinī Matangi in the ājñā cakra.

analyzed: anaṃga śaśi rekhā mataṃginyai namaḥ brahmaraṃdhre
translated: Salutations to Anangamadhuśekharā Matangi in the brahma randhra.

analyzed: iti vinyasya
translated: Having assigned this,

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa śakti nyāsam kuryāt
translated: one should perform the nyasa of the sixteen śaktis.

original: oṃ hrī/ śrī/ mātaṃgījyeṣṭābhyāṃ namaḥ mūlādhāre /
analyzed: om hrī śrī mātaṃgī jyeṣṭābhyām namaḥ mūlādhāre
translated: Om Hrim Shrim, salutations to Matangi and Jyestā in the Mūlādhāra.

analyzed: mātaṃgi vāmābhyām namaḥ svādhiṣṭāne  mātaṃgī raudrābhyām namaḥ nābhau
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Vāmā in the Svādhiṣṭhāna.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Raudrā in the navel.

original: mātaṃgīpraśāntibhyāṃ namaḥ anāhare /🔽mātaṃgīdvaṃdvābhyāṃ namaḥ kaṃṭhe /🔽mātaṃgīmaheśvarībhyāṃ namaḥ bhrūmadhye /
analyzed: mātaṃgī praśāntibhyām namaḥ anāhare  mātaṃgī dvaṃdvābhyām namaḥ kaṃṭhe  mātaṃgī maheśvarībhyām namaḥ bhrū madhye
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Praśānti in the Anahata.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Dvandva in the throat.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Maheśvarī between the eyebrows.

analyzed: mātaṃgī lakṣmībhyām namaḥ kalāyām
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Kriyā in the forehead.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Lakṣmī in the Kalā.

analyzed: mātaṃgī sṛṣṭibhyām namaḥ nirodhikāyām  mātaṃgī mohinībhyām namaḥ ardha indau
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Sṛṣṭi in the Nirodhikā.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Mohinī in the half-moon.

analyzed: mātaṃgī pramathābhyām namaḥ nābhau  mātaṃgī āśvāsinībhyām namaḥ pādayoḥ
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Pramathā in the navel.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Āśvāsini in the feet.

analyzed: mātaṃgī vidyut latābhyām namaḥ unmanyām
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Vidyullaṭā in the Unmanī.

original: mātaṃgīcichaktibhyāṃ namaḥ viṣṇuvakra /🔽mātaṃgīsundarībhyāṃ namaḥ dhruṃvaṃ maḍale /
analyzed: mātaṃgī cit śaktibhyām namaḥ viṣṇu vakra  mātaṃgī sundarībhyām namaḥ dhruṃ vaṃ maḍale
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Cichchhakti in the Viṣṇu-vakra.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Sundarī in the Dhruva-maṇḍala.

analyzed: mātaṃgī ānandābhyām namaḥ śirasiḥ
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Unmakhā in the Śiva-maṇḍala.🔽Salutations to Matangi and Ānandā on the head.

analyzed: mātaṃgī naṃdābhyām namaḥ mūlādhāre
translated: Salutations to Matangi and Nandā in the Mūlādhāra.

analyzed: iti vinyasya
translated: Having thus assigned,

analyzed: śuddha mātṛ kāsam kuryāt
translated: One should perform the pure mātrkā.

analyzed: atha karanyāsa
translated: Now, the karanyāsa.

original: a/ ka/ kha/ ga/ gha/ ṅa/ ā/ aṃguṣṭābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: a ka kha ga gha ṅa ā aṅguṣṭābhyām namaḥ
translated: A. Ka. Kha. Ga. Gha. Ṅa. Ā. To the thumbs, salutations.

original: i/ caṃ cha/ ja/ jha/ ña/ ī/ tarjanībhyā/ namaḥ /
analyzed: i caṃ cha ja jha ña ī tarjanībhyām namaḥ
translated: I. Ca. Cha. Ja. Jha. Ṇa. Ī. To the index fingers, salutations.

original: u/ ṭa/ ṭha/ ḍa/ ḍha/ ṇa/ ū/ madhyamābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: u ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa ū madhyamābhyām namaḥ
translated: U. Ṭa. Ṭha. Ḍa. Ḍha. Ṇa. Ū. To the middle fingers, salutations.

original: ai/ ta/ tha/ da/ dha/ na/ ai/ anāmikābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: ai ta tha da dha na ai anāmikābhyām namaḥ
translated: Ai. Ta. Tha. Da. Dha. Na. Ai. To the ring fingers, salutations.

original: o/ pa/ pha/ va bha/ ma/ au/ kaniṣṭīkābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: o pa pha va bha ma au kaniṣṭīkābhyām namaḥ
translated: O. Pa. Pha. Ba. Bha. Ma. Au. To the little fingers, salutations.

original: a/ ya/ ra/ la/ va/ śa/ ṣa/ sa/ ha/ lakṣaḥ aḥ karatalakarapṛṣṭābhyā/ namaḥ /
analyzed: a ya ra la va śa ṣa sa ha lakṣaḥ aḥ kara tala kara pṛṣṭābhyām namaḥ
translated: A. Ya. Ra. La. Va. Śa. Ṣa. Sa. Ha. Lakṣa. Aḥ. To the palms and backs of the hands, salutations.

analyzed: eva hṛd ādi nyāsaḥ
translated: This is the nyāsa of the heart and other parts.

original: atha mātṛkānyāsaḥ /🔽a/ namaḥ śirasi ā/ namaḥ mukhe / i namaḥ dakṣanetre / ī/ namaḥ vāmanetre /🔽u nama dakṣakarṇe / ū/ namaḥ vāmakarṇe / ṛ/ namaḥ dakṣanāsāpuṭe /
analyzed: atha mātṛkā nyāsaḥ  a namaḥ śirasi ā namaḥ mukhe i namaḥ dakṣanetre ī namaḥ vāmanetre  u nama dakṣa karṇe  ū namaḥ vāma karṇe  ṛ namaḥ dakṣa nāsāpuṭe
translated: Now, the mātrkā nyāsa.🔽A. Salutations on the head. Ā. Salutations on the face. I. Salutations on the right eye. Ī. Salutations on the left eye.🔽U. Salutations on the right ear. Ū. Salutations on the left ear. Ṛ. Salutations on the right nostril.

original: ṝ/ namaḥ vāmanāsāpuṭe / ḷ/ namaḥ dakṣagaṃḍe / ḹ/ namaḥ vāmagaṃḍe /
analyzed: namaḥ vāma nāsā puṭe namaḥ dakṣa gaṃḍe namaḥ vāma gaṃḍe
translated: Ṛ. Salutations on the left nostril. ऌ. Salutations on the right cheek. ॡ. Salutations on the left cheek.

original: e namaḥ ūdhvoṣṭo ai/ namaḥ adharoṣṭe / o/ namaḥ ūrdhvadantapaṃktau /
analyzed: namaḥ ūdhva uṣṭe ai namaḥ adhara uṣṭe  o namaḥ ūrdhva dantapaṃktau
translated: E. Salutations on the upper lip. Ai. Salutations on the lower lip. O. Salutations on the upper row of teeth.

original: au/ namaḥ adhodantapaṃktau / a/ namaḥ śirasi / aḥ namaḥ mukhe /
analyzed: au namaḥ adhodantapaṃktau a namaḥ śirasi aḥ namaḥ mukhe
translated: Oṃ, salutations to the lower row of teeth. A, salutations to the head. Aḥ, salutations to the mouth.

original: ke namaḥ hṛkṣavāhūmūle / khe namaḥ kūrpare / maṃ namaḥ maṇivaṃdhe /
analyzed: ke namaḥ hṛ kṣa vāhū mūle khe namaḥ kūrpare maṃ namaḥ maṇivaṃdhe
translated: Ke, salutations to the base of the right arm. Khe, salutations to the wrist. Maṃ, salutations to the wrist joint.

original: gha/ namaḥ / aṃgulimūle / ṅaṃ namaḥ aṃgulyagre /🔽ca/ namaḥ vāmavāhū mūle / chaṃ namaḥ kūrpare / ja/ namaḥ maṇivaṃdhe /🔽ṛ/ namaḥ aṃgulimūle / ña/ namaḥ aṃgulyagre / ṭa/ namaḥ dakṣapādamūle /
analyzed: gha namaḥ aṃguli mūle  ṅaṃ namaḥ aṃguli agre  ca namaḥ vāma vāhū mūle chaṃ namaḥ kūrpare ja namaḥ maṇi vaṃdhe  ṛ namaḥ aṅguli mūle ña namaḥ aṅguli agre ṭa namaḥ dakṣa pāda mūle
translated: Gha, salutations to the base of the fingers. Ṅaṃ, salutations to the tips of the fingers.🔽Cha, salutations to the base of the left arm. Chha, salutations to the wrist. Ja, salutations to the wrist joint.🔽Ṛ, salutations to the base of the fingers. Ṇa, salutations to the tips of the fingers. Ṭa, salutations to the base of the right foot.

original: ṭha/ namaḥ jānuni / ḍa/ namaḥ gulphe / ḍha/ namaḥ aṃgulimūle /
analyzed: ṭha namaḥ jānuni ḍa namaḥ gulphe ḍha namaḥ aṃguli mūle
translated: Tha, salutations to the knee. Ḍa, salutations to the ankle. Ḍha, salutations to the base of the fingers.

original: ṇa/ namaḥ aṃgulyagre / taṃ namaḥ vāmapāde / tha/ namaḥ jānuni /
analyzed: ṇa namaḥ aṃguli agre taṃ namaḥ vāma pāde tha namaḥ jānuni
translated: Ṇa, salutations to the tips of the fingers. Taṃ, salutations to the left foot. Tha, salutations to the knee.

original: da/ namaḥ gulphe/ / dha namaḥ aṃguli mūle / na/ namaḥ aṃgulyagre /
analyzed: da namaḥ gulphe dha namaḥ aṃguli mūle na namaḥ aṃguli agre
translated: Da, salutations to the ankle. Dha, salutations to the base of the fingers. Na, salutations to the tips of the fingers.

original: paṃ namaḥ dakṣapārśve / phe/ namaḥ / vāmapārśve /
analyzed: paṃ namaḥ dakṣa pārśve phe namaḥ vāma pārśve
translated: Paṃ, salutations to the right side. Phe, salutations to the left side.

original: va/ namaḥ nābhau / bha/ namaḥ pṛṣṭe / maṃ namaḥ jaṭhare /
analyzed: va namaḥ nābhau bha namaḥ pṛṣṭe maṃ namaḥ jaṭhare
translated: Va, salutations to the navel. Bha, salutations to the back. Maṃ, salutations to the belly.

original: a/ namaḥ hṛdi / ra/ namaḥ dakṣāṃse / la/ namo vāmāṃse /
analyzed: a namaḥ hṛdi ra namaḥ dakṣa aṃse la namaḥ vāma aṃse
translated: A, salutations to the heart. Ra, salutations to the right shoulder. La, salutations to the left shoulder.

original: va/ namaḥ nābhau / bha/ namaḥ pṛṣṭe / ma/ namaḥ jaṭhare /🔽ya/ namaḥ hṛdi / ra/ namaḥ dakṣāṃse / la/ namo vāmāṃse /
analyzed: va namaḥ nābhau bha namaḥ pṛṣṭe ma namaḥ jaṭhare  ya namaḥ hṛdi ra namaḥ dakṣa aṃse la namaḥ vāma aṃse
translated: V. Salutations to the navel. B. Salutations to the back. M. Salutations to the stomach.🔽Y. Salutations to the heart. R. Salutations to the right shoulder. L. Salutations to the left shoulder.

original: va/ namaḥ kakudi / śa/ namo hṛdādi dakṣahastāgnāntam /🔽ṣa/ namaḥ hṛdi vāmahastāgrāṃ sanamohṛdādi dakṣapādāgrāntam /
analyzed: va namaḥ kakudi śa namaḥ hṛd ādi dakṣa hasta agni antam  ṣa namaḥ hṛdi vāma hasta agrām sa namaḥ hṛd ādi dakṣa pāda agra antam
translated: V. Salutations to the top of the head. S. Salutations from the heart to the tip of the right hand.🔽S. Salutations from the heart to the tip of the left hand.

original: ha/ namaḥ hṛdādi vāmapādāgrāṃtam /🔽la/ namaḥ / pādādi śiraḥ paryantam /
analyzed: ha namaḥ hṛd ādi vāma pāda agra aṃtam  la namaḥ pāda ādi śiraḥ paryantam
translated: H. Salutations from the heart to the tip of the left foot.🔽L. Salutations from the feet to the head.

original: kṣa namaḥ śirasaḥ pādaparyantamiti dehe vyopayet /
analyzed: kṣa namaḥ śirasaḥ pāda paryantam iti dehe vyopayet
translated: K. Salutations from the head to the feet. Thus one should place the letters in the body.

analyzed: iti mātṛkā nyāsaḥ
translated: This is the Nyasa of the alphabet.

original: oṃ namaḥ śirasi klī/ namaḥ mukhe / uchiṣṭacaṇḍālinī namaḥ hṛdaye /
analyzed: om namaḥ śirasi klī namaḥ mukhe uchiṣṭacaṇḍālinī namaḥ hṛdaye
translated: Om. Salutations to the head. Klim. Salutations to the mouth. Ucchishta Chandalini. Salutations to the heart.

original: sumukhī devī namaḥ nābhau / mahāpiśācinī guhya /
analyzed: sumukhī devī namaḥ nābhau mahāpiśācinī guhya
translated: Goddess Sumukhi. Salutations to the navel. Maha Pisachi. Private parts.

original: hrī/ namaḥ pādayoḥ / ṭhaḥ ṭhaḥ ṭhaḥ namaḥ pādādiśiraḥ paryantam /
analyzed: hrī namaḥ pādayoḥ ṭhaḥ ṭhaḥ ṭhaḥ namaḥ pāda ādi śiraḥ paryantam
translated: Hrim. Salutations to the feet. Th. Th. Th. Salutations from the feet to the head.

original: svāhā namaḥ śirasaḥ pādapryantamiti rvyāyayet /🔽evaṃ nyāsaṃ vidhāya pūrvavadācamya prāṇāyāma trayaṃ kṛtvā guruṃ
analyzed: svāhā namaḥ śirasaḥ pāda pryantam iti  evam nyāsam vidhāya pūrvavat ācamya prāṇāyāma trayam kṛtvā gurum
translated: Svaha. Salutations from the head to the feet. Thus one should place the letters in the body.

analyzed: dhyāyet
translated: Having performed the Nyasa in this way, having sipped water as before, having performed three Pranayama, one should meditate on the Guru.

original: vālāṃ ṣoḍaśavārṣikīṃ śavagatāṃ mādhvī rasāghūrṇitāṃ🔽śyāmāṅgī maruṇā /
analyzed: vālām ṣoḍaśa vārṣikīm śava gatām mādhvī rasa āghūrṇitām  śyāma aṅgī maruṇā
translated: with a dark-complexioned body,

analyzed: varām guṃjā āvalī śobhitām
translated: the excellent one with full breasts, adorned with a garland of bees,

original: hastābhyāṃ dadhatīṃ kapālamamalaṃ tīkṣṇāṃ tathā kartṛkāṃ
analyzed: hastābhyām dadhatīm kapālam amalam tīkṣṇām tathā kartṛkām
translated: holding in her two hands a pure skull and a sharp knife,

analyzed: sa paṃkaje bhagavatīm uchiṣṭa caṇḍālinīm
translated: meditating on the Blessed Lady Ucchistacchandalini, seated on a lotus.

original: iti dhyātvā mūlaṃ yathā śaktyā japaṃ deva devavyoḥ samarpya śrīcakraṃ
analyzed: iti dhyātvā mūlam yathā śaktyā japam deva devavyoḥ samarpya śrīcakram
translated: Having meditated thus, offer the root mantra recitation as much as possible to the God of gods, visualize the Shri Chakra

analyzed: manasā vibhāvya prakṣālya vilikhya pūjayet
translated: in the mind, wash it, draw it, and worship it.

analyzed: aruṇa ākāra bhā tri locanā bhā dvi bhujām ca śavāsana sthitām
translated: Having red form, three eyes, four arms, two arms, seated on a corpse,

original: madhupānaparāṃ parāṃ parāṃ hṛdi śrīcakragatāṃ bhajepi śācīm /
analyzed: madhu pāna parām parām parām hṛdi śrīcakra gatām bhajepi śācīm
translated: devoted to drinking honey, the supreme, supreme, I worship Shachi, residing in the Shri Chakra in the heart.

original: iti dhyātvā mānasairūpacāraiḥ saṃpūjya vahistachrīcakraṃ caturaśraṃ
analyzed: iti dhyātvā mānasaiḥ ūpacāraiḥ saṃpūjya vahis tat śrī cakram caturaśram
translated: Having meditated thus, worship with mental offerings, outside that Shri Chakra, square,

translated: To him who pervades the moving and unmoving with an unbroken circular form,

original: tanyadaṃ darśite yena tasmai śrīguruve nama // //
analyzed: tanya dam darśite yena tasmai śrī guruve nama
translated: to him who has shown the resounding, salutations to the glorious guru.

analyzed: iti gurum dhyātvā ācamet
translated: Having meditated on the guru thus, one should sip water.

original: gau/ ātmatattvaṃ śodhayāmi svāhā / vidyātattva śodhayāmi svāhā /
analyzed: gau ātma tattvam śodhayāmi svāhā vidyā tattva śodhayāmi svāhā
translated: Gau. I purify the principle of the self, svāhā. I purify the principle of knowledge, svāhā.

original: śivatattvaṃ śodhayāmi svāhā / śivaśaktitattvaṃ śodhayāmi svāhā /
analyzed: śiva tattvam śodhayāmi svāhā śiva śakti tattvam śodhayāmi svāhā
translated: I purify the principle of Śiva, svāhā. I purify the principle of Śiva and Śakti, svāhā.

original: ityācamya pūrvoktaṃ prāṇā vāyuṃ prokṣa oṃ klī/ tatrādhiṣṭānamānīya🔽svaśarīraṃ bhasmībhūta vicintyaṃ yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ brahma
analyzed: iti ācamya pūrva uktam prāṇāḥ vāyum prokṣa om klī tatra adhiṣṭānam ānīya  sva śarīram bhasmībhūta vicintyam yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ brahma
translated: Having sipped water thus, having sprinkled the vital airs as mentioned before, Om Kleem, having brought the consecration there,

original: yathāntarjīvātmānaṃ viciṃtma tatra haṃsa iti sudhāmānīyatayā saṃplāvya
analyzed: yathā antar jīva ātmānam tatra haṃsaḥ iti sudhā mānīya tayā saṃplāvya
translated: one should contemplate one's own body as reduced to ashes, and with Yram Lam Vam one should contemplate the individual soul within. Having brought the nectar with the word hamsa, one should sprinkle it.

original: vigatakalmaṣaṃ dehaṃ vibhāvyasthā tajīvamānīya prāṇān pratiṣṭāpayed iti
analyzed: vigata kalmaṣam deham ānīya prāṇān pratiṣṭāpayet iti
translated: Having visualized the body free from impurities, she should remain alive and establish the vital airs.
This is the purification of the elements.

original: ā/ hrī/ kro/ ya/ ra/ la/ va/ śa/ ṣa/ sa/ ha/ so/ ha/ saḥ mama prāṇa /
analyzed: ā hrī kro ya ra la va śa ṣa sa ha saḥ ha saḥ mama prāṇa
translated: A. Hrī. Kro. Ya. Ra. La. Va. Śa. Ṣa. Sa. Ha. So. Ha. Sa. My vital airs.

original: iha mama jīva iha sthitaḥ mama sarvendriyāṇi vān manacakṣuḥ śrīttra jihvā
analyzed: iha mama jīvaḥ iha sthitaḥ mama sarva indriyāṇi mana cakṣuḥ jihvā
translated: Here, my life is here. My all senses, speech, eyes, ears, nose,

original: ghrāṇā prāṇā ihaivāgatya sukhaṃ ciraṃ tiṣṭantu svāhā /
analyzed: ghrāṇā prāṇāḥ iha eva āgatya sukham ciram tiṣṭantu svāhā
translated: vital airs, having come here, may they remain happily for a long time, svāhā.

analyzed: iti prāṇa pratiṣṭā
translated: This is the establishment of the vital airs.

original: tataḥ punarācamya prāṇāyāmaṃ vidhāya sapūrvakaṃ saṃkalpaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tatas punar ācamya prāṇāyāmam vidhāya sa pūrvakam saṃkalpam kuryāt
translated: Then, having again sipped water and performed breath control, one should perform the preliminary ritual.

original: asya śrīvaradagaṇeśamantrasya brahmā ṛṣi gāyatraṃ chandaḥ🔽śrīgaṇapatirdevatā gaṃ vījaṃ hrī/ śakti kuru kuru kīlakaṃ śrīmahāgaṇa
analyzed: asya śrī vara da gaṇeśa mantrasya brahmā ṛṣiḥ gāyatram chandaḥ  śrī gaṇapatiḥ devatā gaṃ vījam hrī śakti kuru kuru kīlakam śrī mahā gaṇa
translated: Of this glorious mantra of Varuṇa Gaṇeśa, Brahmā is the sage, the Gāyatrī meter,

analyzed: prīti artham jape viniyogaḥ
translated: Śrī Gaṇapati is the deity, Gaṃ is the seed, Hrīṃ is the power, Kuru Kuru is the missile, for the sake of pleasing the glorious great Gaṇeśa, the application is in the recitation.

original: brahmaṛṣaye namaḥ śirasiḥ / gāyatraṃ chandase namo mukhe /
analyzed: brahma ṛṣaye namaḥ śirasiḥ gāyatram chandase namaḥ mukhe
translated: Salutations to the sage Brahmā on the head, salutations to the Gāyatrī meter on the face,

original: mahāgaṇapati devatāyai namaḥ hṛdaye / gaṃ vījāya namo nābhau /
analyzed: mahāgaṇapati devatāyai namaḥ hṛdaye gaṃ vījāya namaḥ nābhau
translated: salutations to the deity Mahāgaṇapati in the heart, salutations to the seed Gaṃ on the navel,

original: hrī/ śaktaye namaḥ guhye / kuru kuru kīlāya namaḥ pādayo /
analyzed: hrī śaktaye namaḥ guhye kuru kuru kīlāya namaḥ
translated: Hri. Salutations to Shakti in the secret place. Kuru Kuru to the Kila, salutations to the feet.

original: trivagasiddhyarthe jape viniyogā namaḥ / sarvāṅgeṣu /🔽gā/ hṛdayāya namaḥ / gī/ śirase svāhā / gu/ śikhāyai vaṣaṭ /
analyzed: trivaga siddhi arthe jape viniyogāḥ namaḥ sarva aṅgeṣu  gā hṛdayāya namaḥ gī śirase svāhā gu śikhāyai vaṣaṭ
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the three goals, the application is in the recitation. Salutations to all the limbs.🔽Ga. Salutations to the heart. Gee. Svāhā to the head. Gu. Vaṣaṭ to the tuft.

original: gai kavacāya hum / gau netrebhyo vauṣaṭ / gaḥ astrāya phaṭ /
analyzed: gai kavacāya hum gau netrebhyaḥ vauṣaṭ gaḥ astrāya phaṭ
translated: Gai. Hum to the armor. Gau. Vauṣaṭ to the eyes. Gaḥ. Phaṭ to the weapon.

analyzed: iti hṛdayāḥ nyāsaḥ atha karanyāsāḥ
translated: This is the heart nyāsa. Now the hand nyāsas.

original: gā/ aṃguṣṭābhyāṃ namaḥ / gī/ tarjanībhyā/ namaḥ /🔽grū/ madhyamābhya/ namaḥ / gai anāmikābhyā/ namaḥ /
analyzed: gāḥ aṃguṣṭābhyām namaḥ gī tarjanībhyām namaḥ  grū madhyamābhyaḥ namaḥ gai anāmikābhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Ga. Salutations to the thumbs. Gee. Salutations to the index fingers.🔽Grū. Salutations to the middle fingers. Gai. Salutations to the ring fingers.

original: gau kaniṣṭābhyāṃ namaḥ / ga karatalapṛṣṭābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: gau kaniṣṭābhyām namaḥ ga kara tala pṛṣṭābhyām namaḥ
translated: Gau. Salutations to the little fingers. Ga. Salutations to the palms and backs of the hands.

analyzed: iti kara nyāsaḥ
translated: This is the hand nyāsa.

original: ātmatattvaṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ / vidyātattvaṃ śirase svāhā /
analyzed: ātma tattvam hṛdayāya namaḥ vidyā tattvam śirase svāhā
translated: The principle of the self, salutations to the heart. The principle of knowledge, svāhā to the head.

original: śivatattvaṃ śikhāya vaṣaṭ / gurutattvaṃ kavacāya hum /
analyzed: śivatattvam śikhāya vaṣaṭ guru tattvam kavacāya hum
translated: The principle of Śiva, vaṣaṭ to the tuft. The principle of the guru, hum to the armor.

original: yogatattvaṃ netrebhyo vauṣaṭ / śivatattvaṃ astrāya phaṭ /
analyzed: yogatattvam netrebhyaḥ vauṣaṭ śivatattvam astrāya phaṭ
translated: The principle of yoga, vauṣaṭ to the eyes. The principle of Śiva, phaṭ to the weapon.

original: ityaṃga nyāsaḥ / evaṃ karanyāsaḥ / iti tattvanyāsaḥ /
analyzed: iti aṃga nyāsaḥ evam kara nyāsaḥ iti tattva nyāsaḥ
translated: This is the limb nyāsa. The hand nyāsa is like this. This is the principle nyāsa.

original: aṃ kaṃ khaṃ gaṃ ghaṃ ṅaṃ ā/ a/guṣṭābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: aṃ kaṃ khaṃ gaṃ ghaṃ ṅaṃ ā aguṣṭābhyām namaḥ
translated: Aṃ kaṃ khaṃ gaṃ ghaṃ ṅaṃ ā. A. Salutations to the thumbs.

original: iṃ caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ iti tarjanībhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: iṃ caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ iti tarjanībhyām namaḥ
translated: Iṃ caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ to the index fingers, salutations.

original: uṃ ṭa/ ṭha/ ḍa/ ḍha/ ṇa/ ū/ madhyamābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: um ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa ū madhyamābhyām namaḥ
translated: Uṃ ṭaṃ ṭhaṃ ḍaṃ ḍhaṃ ṇaṃ ūṃ to the middle fingers, salutations.

original: e/ taṃ tha/ da/ dha/ na/ ai/ anāmikābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: e taṃ tha da dha na ai anāmikābhyām namaḥ
translated: Eṃ taṃ thaṃ daṃ dhaṃ naṃ aiṃ to the ring fingers, salutations.

original: o/ paṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ o/ kaniṣṭābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: o paṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ o kaniṣṭābhyām namaḥ
translated: Oṃ paṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ oṃ to the little fingers, salutations.

original: aṃ yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ śaṃ ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ laṃ kṣaṃḥ / aḥ
analyzed: aṃ yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ śam ṣaṃ sam haṃ laṃ   aḥ
translated: Aṃ yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ śaṃ ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ laṃ kṣaṃ aḥ

analyzed: kara tala pṛṣṭābhyām namaḥ
translated: to the palms and backs of the hands, salutations.

original: evaṃ hṛ nyāsasaḥ /🔽gaṃ kāśīpīṭhāya namaḥ / hṛdaye /
analyzed: evam hṛ nyāsasaḥ  gaṃ kāśīpīṭhāya namaḥ hṛdaye
translated: Thus is the heart nyāsa.🔽Gaṃ to the seat of Kāśī, salutations, in the heart.

original: gaṃ kāṃcīpurīpīṭhāya namaḥ śirasi /🔽gaṃ madhupurīpiṭhāya namaḥ / śikhāyām /
analyzed: gaṃ kāṃcīpurī pīṭhāya namaḥ śirasi  gaṃ madhupurī piṭhāya namaḥ śikhāyām
translated: Gaṃ to the seat of Kāñcīpurī, salutations, on the head.🔽Gaṃ to the seat of Madhupurī, salutations, on the tuft.

original: gaṃ uḍḍāyānapīṭhāya namaḥ / kavace /🔽gaṃ ayodhyāpīṭhāya namaḥ netre /
analyzed: gaṃ uḍḍāyāna pīṭhāya namaḥ kavace  gaṃ ayodhyā pīṭhāya namaḥ netre
translated: Gaṃ to the seat of Uḍḍiyāna, salutations, on the armor.🔽Gaṃ to the seat of Ayodhyā, salutations, on the eyes.

analyzed: gaṃ jālaṃdhara pīṭhāya namaḥ astre
translated: Gaṃ to the seat of Jālandhara, salutations, on the weapon.

analyzed: iti pīṭhanyāsaḥ
translated: Thus is the seat nyāsa.

original: oṃ hṛdayāya namaḥ / śrīmahāgataye śirase svāhā /
analyzed: om hṛdayāya namaḥ śrī mahāgataye śirase svāhā
translated: Oṃ salutations to the heart. Śrī to the great goal, head, svāhā.

original: kāṃ varavaradaśikhāyai vaṣaṭ / klī/ sarvaṃ janaṃ mekavacāya hum /
analyzed: kām vara vara da śikhāyai vaṣaṭ klī sarvam janam mekavacāya hum
translated: Kāṃ to the boon-granting tuft, vaṣaṭ. Klīṃ to all people, armor, huṃ.

original: glau vaśamānaye netrebhyo ṣaṭ / gaṃ svāhā astrāya phaṭ /
analyzed: glau vaśam ānaye netrebhyaḥ ṣaṭ gaṃ svāhā astrāya phaṭ
translated: Glrau to bring under control, to the eyes, ṣaṭ. Gaṃ svāhā to the weapon, phaṭ.

analyzed: evam karam nyāsaḥ
translated: Thus is the hand nyāsa.

original: evaṃ nyāsaṃ vidhāya śrīcakraṃ chyātvā caturaśraṃ ṣoḍaśadalaṃ🔽vasudalaṃ daśāraṃ trikoṇaṃ vinduṃ vicintyaṃ bhadrapīṭhoparimūlena
analyzed: evam nyāsam vidhāya śrīcakram chyātvā caturaśram ṣoḍaśa dalam  vasu dalam daśa aram trikoṇam vindum vicintyam bhadrapīṭha upari mūlena
translated: Having performed the nyasa in this way, one should visualize the Shrichakra, the square, the sixteen-petaled,

analyzed: saṃsthāpya yogapīṭha pūjām kuryāt
translated: the eight-petaled, the ten-spoked, the triangle, and the bindu, and having installed it on the auspicious seat with the root mantra, one should perform the worship of the yogic seat.

original: hrī/ maṃḍūkāya namaḥ / kālāgni rudradrāya namaḥ /
analyzed: hrī maṃḍūkāya namaḥ kālāgni rudradrāya namaḥ
translated: Hri. Salutations to the Manduka. Salutations to the Kala Agni Rudra.

analyzed: mūlaprakṛtyai namaḥ   ādhāra śaktyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the primordial nature. Salutations to the base Shakti.

original: kurmāya namaḥ / anantāya namaḥ / varāhāya namaḥ /
analyzed: kurmāya namaḥ anantāya namaḥ varāhāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the tortoise. Salutations to Ananta. Salutations to Varaha.

original: pṛthivyai namaḥ / urpyuparisaṃpūjya tanmadhye sudhārṇavāya namaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyai namaḥ urpī upari saṃpūjya tad madhye sudhārṇavāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the earth. Having worshipped on the lotus, in the middle of it, salutations to the nectar ocean.

analyzed: na ca ratna virājita namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the mind, which is not made of jewels, is not adorned with jewels, and is made of nine parts, and is the abode of consciousness.

analyzed: tatre śāna ādi sraṣṭasu prādakṣiṇyena nava ratna khaṇḍebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: There, in the creation of the directions etc., salutations to the nine parts made of jewels, in a clockwise direction.

analyzed: etat madhye padmarāga khaṇḍāya namaḥ
translated: In the middle of this, salutations to the part made of ruby.

original: madhye suvarṇaparvatāya namaḥ / madhye nandanodmānāya namaḥ /
analyzed: madhye suvarṇa parvatāya namaḥ madhye nandana udmānāya namaḥ
translated: In the middle, salutations to the golden mountain. In the middle, salutations to the Nandana forest.

original: madhye valā valāvanāya namaḥ / madhyanandanoghānāṃya namaḥ /
analyzed: madhye valā valā vanāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: In the middle, salutations to the forest of Bala and Vala. In the middle, salutations to the Nandana forest.

original: madhye sarovarāya namaḥ / madhye padmavanāya namaḥ /
analyzed: madhye sarovarāya namaḥ madhye padma vanāya namaḥ
translated: In the middle, salutations to the lake. In the middle, salutations to the lotus grove.

original: madhye vicitraratnakhacitabhūmikāyai namaḥ /🔽madhe sahasrastaṃbhānvitamadhyastaṃbha vivarjita catuṣpaṃcāśad
analyzed: madhye vicitra ratna khacita bhūmikāyai namaḥ  sahasra staṃbha anvita madhya staṃbha catuṣpaṃcāśat
translated: In the middle, homage to the ground adorned with various jewels.

analyzed: yojana vistīrṇa nānā ratna kha khita cintāmaṇi maṇḍapāya namaḥ
translated: In the middle, to the pavilion of wish-fulfilling jewels adorned with various jewels, 50 yojanas in extent, devoid of the central pillar among the thousand pillars, homage.

original: madhye navaratnakhacita ratnamayavedikāyai namaḥ /🔽upari ratnasiṃhāsanāya namaḥ upari uccaiḥ śvetā chatrāya namaḥ /
analyzed: madhye nava ratna khacita ratna maya vedikāyai namaḥ  upari ratna siṃhāsanāya namaḥ upari uccais śvetā chatrāya namaḥ
translated: In the middle, homage to the jeweled altar adorned with nine jewels.🔽Above, homage to the jeweled lion throne. Above, homage to the lofty white parasol.

analyzed: pāṭhe sma kalvita agni koṇa ādiṣu dharma ādibhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: In the recitation, homage to Dharma and others in the southeast and other directions.

analyzed: kalpita pūrva ādiṣu adharma ādibhyaḥ namaḥ madhya
translated: Homage to non-Dharma and others in the east and other directions imagined. In the middle,

analyzed: ānanda kandāya saṃcit nalāya namaḥ sahasra dala kamala āsanāya namaḥ
translated: Homage to the bliss-filled bulb, to the severed stalk. Homage to the seat of the lotus with a thousand petals.

original: prakṛtimaye sarebhyo nama / vikṛtimaya patnebhyo namaḥ /
analyzed: prakṛti maye sarebhyaḥ nama vikṛti maya patnebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to the elements consisting of primordial nature. Homage to the elements consisting of modifications.

analyzed: paṃcāśat varṇa vīja āḍhya sarva tattva rūpāyai karṇikāyai namaḥ
translated: Homage to the pericarp rich with the seed-syllables of the fifty letters, having the form of all principles.

original: upari aṃ arkamaṇḍalāya namaḥ / saṃ somamaṇḍalāya namaḥ /
analyzed: upari aṃ arka maṇḍalāya namaḥ saṃ soma maṇḍalāya namaḥ
translated: Above, homage to the orb of the sun. Homage to the orb of the moon.

original: raṃ agnimaṇḍalāya namaḥ / taṃ tamase namaḥ / raṃ jajase namaḥ /
analyzed: raṃ agni maṇḍalāya namaḥ taṃ tamase namaḥ raṃ jajase namaḥ
translated: Homage to the orb of fire. Homage to tamas. Homage to rajas.🔽Homage to sattva.

original: saṃ satvāya namaḥ hrī/ ga/ hrī/ sarvamantrāsanāya namaḥ /
analyzed: sam sattvāya namaḥ hrī ga hrī sarva mantra āsanāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Samsattva, Hrim Gam Hrim, to the seat of all mantras, salutations.

original: oṃ amityā dikṣātamucārya śivaśakti sadāveśvara mahāgaṇapatī sakalātmane
analyzed: om amityā śiva śakti mahāgaṇapatī sakalātmane
translated: Om Amitya, having uttered this, to the one who is always possessed by Shiva and Shakti, to the great chief of the Gaṇas, to the one who is the soul of all,

analyzed: namaḥ saṃsatvāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Samsattva, salutations.

original: iti yogapīṭhapūjāṃ kṛtvā yātrāṇi sthāpayet /🔽svavāmabhāgatrikoṇa ṣaṭkoṇa vṛtta caturaśrarūpaṃ yantraṃ vilikhya
analyzed: iti yogapīṭha pūjām kṛtvā yātrāṇi sthāpayet  sva vāma bhāga trikoṇa ṣaṭkoṇa vṛtta caturaśra rūpam yantram vilikhya
translated: Having thus worshipped the Yogic seat, one should install the articles.🔽Having inscribed the yantra in the form of a triangle, hexagon, circle, and square in the left part,

original: śaṃkhamudrāṃ pradarśyagāmiti ṣaḍaṃgamantraiḥ saṃpūjya astrāya phaḍīti
analyzed: śaṃkha mudrām pradarśya gām iti ṣaḍaṃga mantraiḥ saṃpūjya astrāya phaṭ iti
translated: Having displayed the conch mudrā and worshipped with the six-limbed mantras beginning with Gā, having washed the feet with Astraya Phaṭ,

original: pādikāṃ prakṣālya mūlena saṃsthāpya raṃ vahni maṇḍalāya daśakalātmane
analyzed: pādikām prakṣālya mūlena saṃsthāpya raṃ vahni maṇḍalāya daśa kalā ātmane
translated: Having installed with the root mantra, Ram to the fire mandala, to the one consisting of ten parts,

analyzed: namaḥ  iti mahāgaṇapati pātra āsanāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations.🔽Thus, salutations to the seat of the vessel of the great chief of the Gaṇas.

analyzed: iti gaṃdha akṣataiḥ abhyarcya
translated: Having thus worshipped with scents and unbroken rice,

analyzed: tad upari pātram saṃsthāpya
translated: Having placed the vessel on that,

analyzed: sūrya maṇḍalāya dvādaśa kalā ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the solar mandala, to the one consisting of twelve parts.

analyzed: mahāgaṇapati aghapātrāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the vessel of the great chief of the Gaṇas, which removes sins.

original: iti gaṃdhākṣatairatyarbhya tato kuśamudrayā gaṃgeti tīryanyāvāhya
analyzed: iti gaṃdha akṣataiḥ atyarbhya kuśa mudrayā gaṃgā iti
translated: Having thus worshipped with scents and unbroken rice, having invoked with the Kusha mudrā and the hymn Gange,

analyzed: mūla aṣṭabhiḥ mantra ṣaṣ aṃgaiḥ sva paripūjya matsya mudrayā chādya phaṭ iti
translated: With the root mantra and the six-limbed mantra, having worshipped oneself and others with the Matsya mudra, cover with Phaṭ.

analyzed: choṭ iti choṭikābhiḥ kṛtya
translated: With Choṭi and Choṭika, having protected the path of departure, having enveloped with Avaguṇṭha, having made it nectar with Amṛta,

translated: I know what is Dharma and I engage in it. I know what is not Dharma and I do not engage in it.

original: tvayā hṛṣikeśa hṛdi sthitena yathā niyuktosmi tathā karomi /
analyzed: tvayā hṛṣikeśa hṛdi sthitena yathā niyuktaḥ asmi tathā karomi
translated: O Hṛṣīkeśa, residing in the heart, I do as I am directed by you.

analyzed: iti smṛtvā svayat adṛṣṭi bhātram avalokya gṛdam āgachedaḥ
translated: Having remembered this, having looked at the self with the eye of knowledge, one should come to the house.

analyzed: pādau prakṣālya camya yāga maṇḍapam āgatya
translated: Having washed the feet and sipped water, having come to the sacrificial pavilion,

analyzed: gaṃgāyai namaḥ pari pari viṃ vidhātre namaḥ dvārādhas
translated: Salutations to Gaṅgā. Parī parī to the twelve. Salutations to Vidhātrī below the door.

original: daṃ dvāraśrīyai namaḥ / dvāramadhye / de dehalyai namaḥ /
analyzed: daṃ dvāra śrīyai namaḥ dvāra madhye de dehalyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Dvāraśrī in the middle of the door. Salutations to Dehalī.

original: vaṃ vāstupuruṣāya namaḥ /🔽iti puṣpacandanākṣataiḥ saṃpūjya pūjāvedikāmāgatya yathā
analyzed: vam vāstu puruṣāya namaḥ  iti puṣpa candana akṣataiḥ saṃpūjya pūjā vedikām āgatya yathā
translated: Salutations to Vāstupuruṣa.🔽Having worshipped with flowers, sandal paste, and unbroken rice, having come to the altar of worship, having placed one's own seat with the desire to worship,

analyzed: kāmanā pūrvakam ātma āsanam sthāpya asau
translated: one should install the seat of the Goddess.

analyzed: ādhāra śakti kamalāsanāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the seat of the Goddess of the foundation of all.

original: iti mantreṇa svāsane upaviśva bhūtāni mantrāsya pādyātakarā sphoṭe astrāya🔽phaṭ /
analyzed: iti mantreṇa svāsane bhūtāni sphoṭe astrāya  phaṭ
translated: With this mantra, sit on your own seat. For the protection of the body, feet, and hands, say Om, for the weapon, Phat.

original: iti mantreṇa bhūtatrāsanaṃ kuryāt guraṃ śirasi smṛtvā bhūtaśuddhiṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: iti mantreṇa bhūta trāsanam kuryāt guram śirasi smṛtvā bhūtaśuddhim kuryāt
translated: With this mantra, one should frighten away the spirits. Remembering the teacher on the head, one should perform the purification of the spirits.

original: prāṇāyamakrameṇa svādhiṣṭānākhya ṣaṭkoṇād āgataṃ vāyuvījaṃ yamiti
translated: In the sequence of breath control, the wind seed syllable Yam comes from the six-cornered place called the secret part.

analyzed: saṃciṃbhyaḥ kṛṣṇa varṇa te nu śoṣayet
translated: Having inhaled it, one should dry up the black-colored body.

original: samyagāsīna śrāsani dakṣiṇanāsāpuṭena pūrakaṃ kṛtvā trirākṛtyā
analyzed: dakṣiṇa nāsā puṭena pūrakam kṛtvā tris ākṛtyā
translated: Sitting properly, having filled through the right nostril,

original: kudbhakaṃ nāsāpuṭadvayadhāraṇarūpaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇe na recayet /
analyzed: kudbhakam nāsā puṭa dvaya dhāraṇa rūpam kṛtvā dakṣiṇe na recayet

analyzed: kaniṣṭhā anāmikā aṅkaṣṭaiḥ nāsā puṭa dhāraṇam prāṇāyāmaḥ
translated: The retention of breath is done by pressing the nostrils with the ring finger, middle finger, and thumb.

analyzed: tanu śoṣaṇe vāma kukṣau pāpa puruṣam vicintayet
translated: In the drying of the body, one should contemplate the sinful man in the left armpit.

original: kajjāllābhaṃ brahmahṛtyā śiraskaṃ varṇasteya bhujayugalaṃ surāpāna hṛdaye🔽abhakṣabhakṣaṇādyupapātakāṅgapraṃbhyagakaṃ gurutalpa
analyzed: brahma hṛtyā śiraskam varṇa steya bhuja yugalam surā pāna hṛdaye

analyzed: kaṭi kharḍga carma dharam kruddham
translated: holding a sword and shield, angry,

original: iti saṃcintya tadu sthite na vāyunā pracaṇḍā na pāpapuruṣasahita tanoḥ
analyzed: iti saṃcintya sthite na vāyunā na tanoḥ
translated: Thinking thus, he remained there, not shaken by strong winds, not by the sinful man's body,

analyzed: śoṣaṇam kṛtvā sakṛt āvṛtyā vāma nāsā puṭena recayet
translated: Thinking thus, he should not exhale through the right nostril, but should exhale through the left nostril once, after drying up the body along with the evil person by the fierce wind.

analyzed: tatas niṣpāyantam vam iti amṛta mantreṇa amṛta āplāvanam kṛtvā
translated: Then, after sprinkling the nectar with the nectar mantra,

analyzed: tena amṛtena utyantre deham āplācayet
translated: he should sprinkle the body with that nectar.

analyzed: iti bhūtaśuddhiḥ
translated: This is the purification of the elements.

analyzed: atha prāṇa pratiṣṭā
translated: Now, the installation of the vital breaths.

analyzed: ā hrī kraḥ ya ra la va śa ṣa ha sa ha saḥ moha vagalāmukhi va iha sthitaḥ

analyzed: ā hrī krau vagalāmukhim vāc manaḥ śrotra ghrāṇa prāṇāḥ iha eva āgatya
translated: A. Hri. Kro. Vagalamukhi. Speech, mind, hearing, smelling, and vital breaths come here and

analyzed: tatas tanum svāyām sthirām dṛḍhām bhāvayet

analyzed: pūrva uktaḥ iti āha

analyzed: iti prāṇa pratiṣṭha

analyzed: atha mātṛkā nyāsa

analyzed: mātṛkā devatā hṛdaye

analyzed: vyaṃjanāni vījāni guhye

analyzed: atha mātṛkā ṣaḍaṃga nyāsaḥ

translated: Thus, the six-limbed assignment of the Mātṛkā (syllables) removes all sins.

translated: O and AU on the teeth, Aṃ on the head, Aḥ inside the mouth,

translated: Ṭa, Ṭha, Ḍa, Ḍha, Ṇa, Ta, Tha, Da, Dha, Na - in the right and left feet, at the

analyzed: saṃdhi agreṣṭa

original: saṃ śukre hṛdayādi pāṇiyuge / haṃ ātmani hṛdayādi pāṇe yuge /🔽haṃ ātmani hṛdayādi pādayādi pādayuge mukhe /

analyzed: iti va hi mātṛkā nyāsaḥ

analyzed: brahmāstra pūjana vidhim pra kṣyāmi samāsatas
translated: I shall explain the method of worshipping the Brahma weapon in brief.

analyzed: sādhakānām hita arthāya staṃbhanāya ca vairiṇām
translated: For the benefit of practitioners and for the suppression of enemies.

analyzed: kṛta nitya kriyaḥ
translated: Having performed the daily rites,

original: prāṇāyamaṃ sthalaśuddhi bhūtaśuddhi prāṇapratiṣṭā mātṛkā nyāsa
translated: Pranayama, purification of the site, purification of the elements, installation of the life force, and the Nyasa of the Matrka,

analyzed: prāṇāyāma pūrvakam guru caraṇa aravindam śirasim abhyarcya
translated: Having worshipped the lotus feet of the Guru on the head, preceded by Pranayama,

analyzed: asyāḥ śrī vagalāmukhi vidyā yā
translated: This is the Vidya of the illustrious Vagalamukhi.

analyzed: brahmā ṛṣiḥ śirasi devī gāyatri chandaḥ mukhe  śrī vagalāmukhi devatā ādaye
translated: The sage is Brahma. On the head. The goddess Gayatri is the meter. On the face.

original: klī/ vījaṃ dakṣastene svāhāśaktiḥ vāmastane / o/ kīlakaṃ nābhau /
analyzed: klī vījam dakṣa stene svāhā śaktiḥ vāma stane  o kīlakam nābhau
translated: To the deity Vagalamukhi, Klim is the seed syllable on the right breast, Svaha is the power on the left breast, Om is the locking syllable on the navel.

analyzed: mama caturvidha puruṣa artha siddhārthe jape viniyoga
translated: For the accomplishment of the four human goals, I am engaged in the recitation.

analyzed: iti aṃgulim vaddhā namaskuryāt
translated: Thus, having formed the mudra, one should bow down.

analyzed: athavā cūlakena jalam bhūmau nikṣipet
translated: Or, one should pour water on the ground with the cupped hands.

translated: Om, Aim, Ham, to Vagalamukhi, I offer salutations with the index fingers.🔽Om, Aim, Hlam, to Vagalamukhi, I offer salutations with the middle fingers.

analyzed: o ai hlā vagalāmukhi anāmikābhyām namaḥ  o ai hlā vagalāmukhi kaniṣṭābhyām namaḥ

analyzed: o hlū madhyamābhyām namaḥ au hlai anāmikābhyām namaḥ
translated: Om, Hlum, to the middle fingers, I offer salutations. Om, Hlei, to the ring fingers, I offer salutations.

analyzed: jihvām kīlaya vuddhim vināya kaniṣṭābhyām namaḥ

analyzed: hlī au svāhā kara tala pṛṣṭābhyām namaḥ
translated: Hli Au. Svāhā. To the palms and backs of the hands, salutations.

analyzed: atha ṣaḍaṃganyāsa
translated: Now, the six-limbed nyāsa.

original: au/ ai/ hlā/ vagalāmukhi hṛdayāya namaḥ / o/ ai/ hlā/ vagalāmukhi siraśe svāhā /
analyzed: au ai hlā vagalāmukhi hṛdayāya namaḥ o ai hlā vagalāmukhi siraśe svāhā
translated: Au Ai Hla. Vāgālamukhī. To the heart, salutations. O Ai Hla. Vāgālamukhī. To the head, svāhā.

original: o/ ai/ hlā/ vagalāmukhi śikhāyai vaṣaṭ / o/ ai/ hlā/ vagalāmukhi kavacāya
analyzed: o ai hlā vagalāmukhi śikhāyai vaṣaṭ o ai hlā vagalāmukhi kavacāya
translated: O Ai Hla. Vāgālamukhī. To the tuft, vaṣaṭ. O Ai Hla. Vāgālamukhī. To the armor,

analyzed: hū
translated: HŪṃ.

original: o/ ai/ hlā/ vagalāmukhi netratrayāya vauṣaṭ / o/ ai/ hla/ astrāya ṣaṭ /
analyzed: o ai hlā vagalāmukhi netratrayāya vauṣaṭ o ai hla astrāya ṣaṭ
translated: O Ai Hla. Vāgālamukhī. To the three eyes, vauṣaṭ. O Ai Hla. To the weapon, ṣaṭ.

analyzed: hlā hṛdayāya namaḥ pūrvavat
translated: Hla. To the heart, salutations. As before.

original: o/ hlā/ hṛdayā namaḥ / vagalāmukhi śirasi pūrvavat /
analyzed: o hlā hṛdayā namaḥ vagalāmukhi śirasi pūrvavat
translated: O Hla. To the heart, salutations. Vāgālamukhī. To the head, as before.

analyzed: iti ṣaḍaṃganyāsaḥ
translated: This is the six-limbed nyāsa.

original: tato mūlavidyāmucārya / ātmatattvavyāpini vagalāmukhyaṃ pūjayāmi hṛdaye /
analyzed: tatas mūlavidyām ucārya ātma tattva vyāpini vagalā mukhyam pūjayāmi hṛdaye
translated: Then, having recited the root mantra, I worship Vāgālamukhī, who pervades the principle of the self, in the heart.

original: mūlena tatvavyāpini vagalāmukhi vā śrīpādukāṃ pūjayāmi śirasi /🔽mūlavidyāmucārya sarvatattvavyāpinī vagalāmukhiṃ vā śrīpādukāṃ
analyzed: mūlena tatva vyāpini vagalā mukhi vā śrī pādukām pūjayāmi śirasi  mūlavidyām ucārya sarva tattva vyāpinī vagalāmukhim vā śrī pādukām
translated: At the root, in the all-pervading reality, I worship the lotus feet of Vāgīśvarī on the head.🔽Reciting the root mantra, I worship the lotus feet of Vāgīśvarī, who pervades all realities,

analyzed: pūjayāmi brahmarandhre
translated: at the brahmarandhra.

analyzed: atha dhyānam
translated: Now, the meditation:

analyzed: madhye sudhā abdhi maṇi maṇḍapa ratna vidyām parigatām  paripīta varṇām
translated: In the middle, on a jeweled throne in the ocean of nectar,

analyzed: devī smarāmi dhṛta
translated: I remember the goddess Vāgīśvarī, whose color is like that of refined gold,🔽whose body is adorned with yellow garments, ornaments, and garlands,

original: mudgaravairijihvām // //🔽jihvāgrasādāya kareṇa devīṃ vāmena śatrun paripīḍayantim /
analyzed: mudgaravairijihvām  kareṇa devīm vāmena śatrun paripīḍayantim
translated: and who holds a hammer and the tongue of enemies.🔽With her right hand, the goddess delights in eating the tips of tongues, and with her left, she torments enemies.

original: gadābhighātena ca dakṣiṇena pītāmvarāḍhyāṃ dvibhujāṃ namāmi // //
analyzed: gadā abhighātena ca dakṣiṇena pītām vara āḍhyām dvi bhujām namāmi
translated: With a blow of her club, I bow to the two-armed goddess, who is adorned with yellow garments.

analyzed: tri śula dhāriṇī devīm sarva siddhi pradāyinim
translated: The goddess who holds a trident, who grants all accomplishments,

analyzed: sarva śṛṃgāra veśa āḍhyām iti dhyātvā prapūjayet
translated: and who is adorned with all ornaments of love - having meditated on her thus, one should worship her.

analyzed: gaṃbhīrām ca mada unmattām tapta kāṃcana saṃnibhām
translated: The deep, intoxicated goddess, who is like molten gold,

analyzed: catu bhujām trinayanām kamalāsana saṃsthitam
translated: has four arms, three eyes, and is seated on a lotus.

original: mudgaraṃ dakṣiṇe vā śaṃ vāme jihvāṃ ca vajrakam /
analyzed: mudgaram dakṣiṇe vā śam vāme jihvām ca vajrakam
translated: In her right hand, she holds a hammer, and in her left, a tongue and a vajra.

original: vibhratiṃ cārusarvāṅgī saṃśuye vagalāmukhim // //🔽pītāṃvaradharāṃ sādra dṛḍhapīnapayodharā /🔽hemakuṇḍalabhūṣāṃ ca pītacandrārdhaśekharām // //
analyzed: vibhratim cāru sarva aṅgī vagalāmukhim  pītām vara dharām sā adra dṛḍha pīna payodharā  hema kuṇḍala bhūṣām ca pīta candra ardha śekharām
translated: And the beautiful Vāgīśvarī, with all her limbs shining,🔽Wearing yellow garments, with firm and full breasts,🔽Adorned with golden earrings, with a yellow crescent moon on her head,

analyzed: pīta bhūṣaṇa bhūṣā aṅgi svarṇa siṃhāsana sthitām
translated: Adorned with yellow ornaments, seated on a golden lion throne,

analyzed: trinetraḥ dvi bhujām ramyām pīta alaṃkāla bhūṣitām
translated: With three eyes, two beautiful arms, adorned with yellow ornaments,

analyzed: pīta mudgara saṃyuktām duṣṭa kaṣṭa nivāsiṇim
translated: Holding a yellow mallet, residing in the abode of evil and distress,

analyzed: pīta varṇā pīta gandha anulepanām
translated: Of yellow complexion, anointed with yellow-colored unguents,

analyzed: tapta kāṃcana varṇa ābhām vagalām cintayet hṛti
translated: Shining with the color of heated gold, one should contemplate the steadfast Vāgīśā.

analyzed: iti dhyātvā pūjayet
translated: Having contemplated thus, one should worship.

analyzed: tatas mūlavidyām ucārya puraścaraṇa ṣaṭtriśat akṣaram prapūjya
translated: Then, having recited the root mantra and worshipped the thirty-six letters of the purścaraṇa,

analyzed: vahis yajanam ārabhat
translated: One should begin the external worship.

analyzed: paṃcaka taru lekhanyā śrī gandha aguru karpūra kastūrī ādi trikoṇa ṣaṭkoṇa
translated: With the writing brush of the five trees, using sandalwood, agaru, camphor, musk, etc., one should draw a triangle, hexagon,

original: aṣṭadalaṣoḍaśadala caturaśraṃ ca nityapūjāṃ yatraṃ vilikhya trikoṇamadhye /
analyzed: aṣṭadala ṣoḍaśadala caturaśram ca nitya pūjām yatram vilikhya trikoṇa madhye
translated: Eight-petaled lotus, sixteen-petaled lotus, and a square for daily worship. Having drawn this, in the center of the triangle,

original: ai/ hrī/ śrī ādhāraśakti kamalāsanāya namaḥ /
analyzed: ai hrī śrī ādhāra śakti kamalāsanāya namaḥ
translated: Ai. Hrī. Śrī. Salutations to the seat of lotus, the power of support.

original: iti devyāsanaṃ saṃpūjyaḥ tataḥ pūrvokta dhyānayogena /
analyzed: iti devī āsanam saṃpūjyaḥ tatas pūrva ukta dhyāna yogena
translated: Having thus worshipped the seat of the Goddess, then, by the yoga of meditation as described before,

original: ādhāracakrasthe na tejorūpiṇīṃ vāmanāḍyāṃ māgeṇa nissārya hṛdaya🔽kamalāt /
analyzed: ādhāra cakra sthe na tejaḥ rūpiṇīm vāma nāḍyām māgeṇa nissārya  kamalāt
translated: Located in the base chakra, in the form of fire, having extracted it through the left nostril, from the lotus of the heart,

analyzed: punar kalpita pīṭha madhye trikoṇe
translated: Again, in the triangle in the middle of the imagined seat,

original: ehyehi śrīvagalāmukhi maṇḍapamadhya avataraṇa śānidhyaṃ kuru kuru
analyzed: ehi ehi śrī vagalāmukhi maṇḍapa madhya avataraṇa kuru kuru
translated: Come, come, O glorious Vāgīśvarī, descend into the middle of the maṇḍala, be present, be present.

analyzed: parameśvarīm āvāhayāmi namaḥ
translated: I invoke the Supreme Goddess, salutations.

analyzed: iti āvāhayet
translated: Thus one should invoke.

analyzed: āvāhanam saṃsthāpanam saṃnirodhana saṃnidhāyana sammukhīkaraṇa
translated: Invocation, installation, restraint, presence, facing,

original: avaguṇṭhana maṇḍalaiḥ sakalīkaraṇāmṛtīkaraṇa paramīkaraṇa nisva sva
analyzed: avaguṇṭhana maṇḍalaiḥ sakalīkaraṇa amṛtīkaraṇa paramīkaraṇa
translated: Covering, and complete with the maṇḍalas, making whole, making immortal, making supreme, and making sound

analyzed: mudrā ādibhiḥ kṛtvā pādya ādikam samarpayet
translated: With the mudras and so on, one should offer the water for washing the feet and so on.

analyzed: tatas mūlavidyā śrī vagalāmukhi idam pādyam gṛhna mama kāryam  kuru
translated: Then, having recited the root mantra, O glorious Vāgīśvarī, accept this water for washing the feet, accomplish my task.

original: śrīvagalāmukhī devyai pādyaṃ samarpayāmi namaḥ / mūlena /🔽śrīvagalāmukhi idamarghyaṃ gṛhna mama kāryaṃ kuru śrīvagalāmukhi
analyzed: śrī vagalāmukhī devyai pādyam samarpayāmi namaḥ mūlena  śrī vagalāmukhi idam arghyam gṛhna mama kāryam kuru śrī vagalāmukhi
translated: I offer water for washing the feet to the goddess Vāgīśvarī, salutations. With the root mantra.

analyzed: devyai arghyam samarpayāmi namaḥ mūlena
translated: O glorious Vāgīśvarī, accept this respectful offering, accomplish my task. I offer the respectful offering to the goddess Vāgīśvarī, salutations. With the root mantra.

analyzed: śrī vagalāmukhī idam
translated: O glorious Vāgīśvarī, accept this honey-mixture along with the food at the end,

analyzed: madhuparka samarpayāmi namaḥ
translated: I offer Madhuparka, salutations.

original: tataḥ puratro candanādināṣṭāṅgulaṃ caturaśraṃ maṇḍalaṃ tan madhye
analyzed: tatas puratras candanādinā aṣṭa aṅgulam caturaśram maṇḍalam tat madhye
translated: Then, with sandalwood paste, one should make an eight-finger-width square maṇḍala in the middle of that,

original: ṣaṭkoṇaṃ kṛtvā tadupari rakṣālitāṃ triyādikāṃ saṃsthāpya tasyopari
analyzed: ṣaṣ koṇam kṛtvā tad upari rakṣālitām triyādikām saṃsthāpya tasya upari
translated: and having made a six-sided figure on top of it, one should place the three-time-purified [fire] on top of that,

original: ādhārapātraṃ sthāpayet / tadyathā /🔽vaṃdhūmrārciṣe namaḥ laṃ kapilāyai namaḥ /
analyzed: ādhāra pātram sthāpayet tat yathā  vaṃ dhūmra arciṣe namaḥ laṃ kapilāyai namaḥ
translated: and place the base vessel on top of that. As follows:🔽Salutations to Vādhūmrayā. Salutations to Laṃ Kapilā.

original: vaṃ visphaliṃginyai namaḥ / śaṃ jvālāmālinyai namaḥ /
analyzed: vaṃ visphaliṃginyai namaḥ śam jvālā mālinyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Vaṃ Viṣphuliṅginī. Salutations to Śaṃ Jvālāmālinī.

original: ṣaṃ arcipmatyai namaḥ / saṃ havyavarāhāyai namaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṃ arcipmatyai namaḥ sam havyavarāhāyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Ṣaṃ Arciṣmatī. Salutations to Saṃ Havyavārahā.

original: haṃ rauḍyai namaḥ / laṃ kṣaṃ sāriṇyai namaḥ /
analyzed: haṃ rauḍyai namaḥ laṃ kṣaṃ sāriṇyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Haṃ Raudrī. Salutations to Laṃ Kṣaṃ Sāriṇī.

original: ityagnikalā saṃpūjya tatorghyaṃ pātrakarpūrādi vāsitaṃ jalena vilomamātṛkā
analyzed: iti agni kalā saṃpūjya tatas arghyam pātra karpūra ādi vāsitam jalena viloma mātṛkā
translated: Having worshipped the fire principle in this way, then one should consecrate the vessel with water scented with camphor and so on, reciting the reverse mātrkā

analyzed: mūlavidyām japan tat pātre
translated: and the root Vidyā in that vessel.

analyzed: arka maṇḍalam dvādaśa kalā pūjāyet tat yathā
translated: One should worship the solar maṇḍala and the twelve digits. As follows:

original: kaṃ vaṃ tapinyai namaḥ / khaṃ bhaṃ tāpinyai namaḥ /
analyzed: kaṃ vaṃ tapinyai namaḥ khaṃ bhaṃ tāpinyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Kaṃ Vaṃ Tapanī. Salutations to Khaṃ Bhaṃ Tāpinī.

original: gaṃ kaṃ śodhinyai namaḥ / ghaṃ paṃ śoṣiṇyai namaḥ /
analyzed: gaṃ kaṃ śodhinyai namaḥ ghaṃ paṃ śoṣiṇyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Gaṃ Kaṃ Śodhinī. Salutations to Ghaṃ Paṃ Śoṣiṇī.

original: ṅaṃ naṃ bhrāmiṇyai namaḥ / caṃ dhaṃ kledinyai namaḥ /
analyzed: ṅaṃ naṃ bhrāmiṇyai namaḥ caṃ dhaṃ kledinyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Ṅaṃ Naṃ Bhramīṇī. Salutations to Caṃ Dhaṃ Kledinī.

original: chaṃ daṃ vareṇyadāyai namaḥ / jaṃ thaṃ susumnāyai namaḥ /🔽jhaṃ taṃ ākarṣiṇyai namaḥ / ñaṃ ṇaṃ vṛṣṭivāhāyai na /
analyzed: chaṃ daṃ vareṇyadāyai namaḥ jaṃ thaṃ susumnāyai namaḥ  jhaṃ taṃ ākarṣiṇyai namaḥ ñaṃ ṇaṃ vṛṣṭi vāhāyai na
translated: Ch, D, to the giver of boons, salutations. J, Th, to the well-pleased one, salutations.🔽Jh, T, to the attractive one, salutations. Ṇ, Ṇ, to the giver of rain, salutations.

original: ḍhaṃ jyeṣṭāyai namaḥ / ḍhaṃ ḍaṃ hiraṇyadāyai namaḥ /
analyzed: ḍhaṃ jyeṣṭāyai namaḥ ḍhaṃ ḍaṃ hiraṇyadāyai namaḥ
translated: Ḍ, Ḍ, to the eldest, salutations. Ḍ, Ḍ, to the giver of gold, salutations.

analyzed: iti arka kalāḥ saṃpūjayet
translated: Thus one should worship the rays of the sun.

original: jale candramaṇḍalāṃ tat kalāḥ pūjayet / tadyathā /
analyzed: jale candra maṇḍalām tat kalāḥ pūjayet tat yathā
translated: And in the water, one should worship the lunar orb and its digits, as follows.

original: aṃ amṛtāyai namaḥ / oṃ manasyai namaḥ /
analyzed: aṃ amṛtāyai namaḥ om manasyai namaḥ
translated: A, to Amṛtā, salutations. O, to Manasā, salutations.

original: iṃ tuṣṭyai namaḥ / īṃ puṣpai namaḥ /
analyzed: iṃ tuṣṭyai namaḥ īṃ puṣpai namaḥ
translated: I, to Tuṣṭi, salutations. I, to Puṣpā, salutations.

original: uṃ pītyai namaḥ / ūṃ ratyai namaḥ /
analyzed: um pītyai namaḥ ūm ratyai namaḥ
translated: U, to Pītyā, salutations. Ū, to Rati, salutations.

original: ṛṃ dhṛtyai namaḥ / ṝṃ śaśinyai namaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṃ dhṛtyai namaḥ ṝṃ śaśinyai namaḥ
translated: Ṛ, to Dhṛti, salutations. Ṛ, to Śaśinī, salutations.

original: o/ kālāyai namaḥ / au/ sapūrṇamaṇḍalāyai namaḥ /
analyzed: o kālāyai namaḥ au sa pūrṇa maṇḍalāyai namaḥ
translated: O, to Kālā, salutations. AU, to Sa-pūrṇa-maṇḍalā, salutations.

original: aṃ pūrṇāmṛtāyai namaḥ / aḥ vāmanāyai namaḥ /
analyzed: aṃ pūrṇāmṛtāyai namaḥ aḥ vāmanāyai namaḥ
translated: A, to Pūrṇāmṛtā, salutations. Aḥ, to Vāmanā, salutations.

analyzed: iti candra ṣoḍaśa kalāḥ saṃpūjayet jala madhye ṣaḍaṅga nyāset
translated: Thus one should worship the sixteen digits of the moon. In the middle of the water, one should perform the six-limbed nyāsa.

analyzed: puṣpāni dadyāt
translated: One should offer the eight-syllabled root mantra, water, and flowers.

analyzed: tatas dhenumudrām yonimudrām ca darśayet
translated: Then one should show the dhenumudrā and yonimudrā.

original: śa śīṃ śuṃ śe śau śa śukraśāya vimocinyai svāhā
analyzed: śa śīṃ śum śe śau śa śukraśāya vimocinyai svāhā
translated: Ś, Śīṃ, Śuṃ, Śe, Śau, Ś, Śukraśāy, to Vimocini, svāhā.

original: ityabhimanya amṛtaṃ śī smṛtvā ai/ klī/ śau amṛte atodbhave amṛteśvari
analyzed: iti abhimanya amṛtam śī smṛtvā ai klī śau amṛte ata udbhave amṛteśvari
translated: Reciting thus, remembering the nectar, A. K. L. S. in the nectar, arisen from that, O Goddess of nectar,

original: amṛtavarṣiṇi amṛtaṃ srāvaya srāvaya sāṃ ju juṃ saḥ / amṛteśvaryai svāhā /
analyzed: amṛta varṣiṇi amṛtam srāvaya srāvaya sām ju juṃ saḥ amṛteśvaryai svāhā
translated: Showering nectar, let nectar flow, let it flow, Saṃ Ju Juṃ Saḥ. To the Goddess of nectar, svāhā.

analyzed: iti amṛte śva tvā dhenumudrāḥ yonimudrāḥ darśayet
translated: Having recited thus on nectar, one should show the Dhenu mudrā and Yoni mudrā.

original: anandabhairava surādevyai śrīpādukāṃ pūjayāmi tarpayāmi namaḥ /
analyzed: ananda bhairava surā devyai śrī pādukām pūjayāmi tarpayāmi namaḥ
translated: To the Goddess of nectar, the bliss-filled Bhairava, I offer worship and satiation, salutations.

original: iti candanagandhapuṣpākṣatātini savye vāme dvitīye mikṣipya pātrāṇi pūrayet /
analyzed: iti candana gandha puṣpa akṣatātini savye vāme dvitīye mikṣipya pātrāṇi pūrayet
translated: Thus, having placed the sandal paste, incense, flowers, and unbroken rice on the right and left second vessels, one should fill them.

original: ādau kuṃbhaṃ tata śaṃkhaṃ śrīpātraṃ śaktipātrakam /
analyzed: ādau kuṃbham tata śaṃkham śrīpātram śakti pātrakam
translated: First the water pot, then the conch, the Śrī vessel, the Śakti vessel,

analyzed: vali pātram bhoga pātrakam
translated: The Vala vessel, and the Bhoga vessel.

analyzed: vali pātram bhoga pātram vīra pātrāṇi saptaśa
translated: The Vala vessel and the Bhoga vessel are the seven Vīra vessels.

original: iti saptapātrāṇi saṃpūjya ātmatattva vidyātattva śivatattva sarvatattvai
analyzed: iti sapta pātrāṇi saṃpūjya ātma tattva vidyā tattva śiva tattva sarva tattvaiḥ
translated: Having thus worshipped the seven vessels, with the principles of the self, the principle of knowledge, the principle of Śiva, and all principles,

analyzed: argha stha amṛta jala pātra antareṇa gṛhitvā vindu catuṣṭayam mukhe nikṣipya
translated: Taking the nectar water from the Arghya vessel in another vessel, placing the four drops in the mouth,

analyzed: tarpaṇam kuryāt
translated: One should perform the satiation.

original: mūlena saptavāraṃ gāvaraṇaṃ tarjanyaguṣṭayogena santarpya tripuṣpāṃjali🔽vidhāya /
analyzed: mūlena sapta vāram tarjanya guṣṭa yogena santarpya tripuṣpa aṃjali 🔽vidhāya
translated: With the root mantra seven times, having satiated with the union of the index finger and thumb, having made the Tripuṣpa Añjali,

original: gāṃ gaṇeśāya namaḥ / pūrva / vaṃ vaṭukāya namaḥ / dakṣiṇadvāre /
analyzed: gām gaṇeśāya namaḥ pūrva  vaṃ vaṭukāya namaḥ dakṣiṇa dvāre
translated: Ga to Ganesha, Namas. East. Va to Vatuka, Namas. South door.

original: daṃ durgāyai namaḥ / paścimadvāre / kṣaṃ kṣetrapālāya namaḥ / uttaradvāre /
analyzed: daṃ durgāyai namaḥ paścima dvāre kṣaṃ kṣetrapālāya namaḥ uttara dvāre
translated: Da to Durga, Namas. West door. Ksha to Kshetrapala, Namas. North door.

analyzed: iśānī ādi sainyāyām guru paṃktim prapūjya
translated: In the northeast and other directions, having worshipped the row of gurus.

analyzed: śrī pūrṇanātha ānandanāthāya lalitām vā śakti yuktāya śrī pādukām
translated: To the venerable Purnanatha, Anandana, Lalita, or Shakti-associated, I worship the lotus feet.

analyzed: pūjayami tarpayāmi namāḥ
