analyzed: indra ādi namitā devī iśvarī ca īśvara priyā
translated: The Goddess bowed to by Indra and others, the Goddess, dear to the Lord,
Bestower of purity, remover of fear, terrifying to those who hate devotees.

original: bhavaveṣā kāmini ca bhīrundrābha ca kāriṇī /
analyzed: kāmini ca ca kāriṇī
translated: Having the form of existence, passionate, timid, causing fear to Indra,

original: paṃcabhū sarvabhūcavibhūtirbhūṃ vidhāriṇī // //🔽siṃhavāhāhya māhyā ca mohapāśavināśini /
analyzed: ca moha pāśa vināśini
translated: Having the splendor of all the five elements, the splendor of the earth, the sustainer of the earth.🔽Having a lion as a vehicle, the destroyer of the noose of delusion,
Sweet-voiced, dwelling in the temple, bearing a seal and a mallet.

original: sāvitri ca mahādevī parapriya vinayakā /🔽yamadūtīrapiṃgākṣī vaiṣṇavī śāṅkarī tathā // //
analyzed: sāvitri ca
translated: Savitri, the great goddess, pleasing to others, the remover of obstacles,🔽The messenger of Yama, having tawny eyes, Vaishnavi, Shaivite,
Fond of the moon, having a moon-like face, residing in the forest of sandalwood trees,
Endowed with the moon and the sun, the destroyer of the demon Chandamunda.

original: sarveśvarī yakṣiṇī ca kirākṣasi tathā /🔽mahāpāpaharā devi mahābhayaharā tathā // //
analyzed: sarveśvarī yakṣiṇī ca kirākṣasi tathā  mahā pāpa harā devi mahā bhaya harā tathā
translated: The goddess of all, a female spirit, and a female demon,🔽The remover of great sins, O goddess, the remover of great fears,
The bestower of great enjoyments, the giver of great liberation,

original: viśvahartti viśvarūpā viśvasaṃhārakāriṇi // //🔽dhātri ca sarvalokānāṃ devānāṃ hitakāriṇī /🔽kāmini kamalā sūkṣmā devī vedhyā mahāvalā // //
analyzed: viśva hartti viśva rūpā viśva saṃhāra kāriṇi  dhātri ca sarva lokānām devānām hita kāriṇī  kāmini kamalā sūkṣmā devī vedhyā mahā valā
translated: The destroyer of the universe, having a universal form, the cause of the destruction of the universe.🔽The nurse of all the worlds, the benefactor of the gods,🔽Passionate, subtle, the goddess worshipped by the gods, of great strength.

analyzed: sura indra pūjitā ca
translated: Worshipped by the lord of the gods, having the splendor of the evening twilight,
The supreme goddess of the earth, in the form of the three worlds,

analyzed: sahasra
translated: Thousand.

analyzed: iti te kathitam devī pīta nāma sahasrakam
translated: Thus, O Goddess, the thousand names of the yellow one have been told to you.

original: paṭhed vā pāṭhayed vāpi sarvasiddhirbhavet priyā // //
analyzed: paṭhet vā pāṭhayet vā api sarva siddhiḥ bhavet priyā
translated: One who recites or causes to recite this, all accomplishments will be dear.

analyzed: itibhyām viṣṇunā proktām mahā staṃbha ekaram param
translated: Thus spoken by Vishnu, the supreme one for the great stupefaction,

analyzed: prātar kāle ca madhyāhne   /
translated: In the morning, at midday, and in the evening, O Parvati,

original: ekaritta paṭhed etat sarvaṃ siddhiṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ekaritta paṭhet etat sarvam siddhim bhaviṣyati
translated: One should recite this once, everything will be accomplished.

analyzed: eka vāram paṭhyet yaḥ tu sarva pāpa kṣayaḥ bhavet
translated: If one recites it once, all sins will be destroyed.

analyzed: yugma vāram paṭhet yaḥ tu gaṇeśa sadṛśaḥ bhavet
translated: If one recites it twice, one will become like Ganesha.
If one recites it three times, O Goddess, all accomplishments will be attained, not otherwise.

analyzed: stavasya asya prabhācena mokṣaḥ bhavati suvrate
translated: By the power of this hymn, liberation is attained, O one of good vows.

original: mokṣārthī labhate mokṣaṃ dhanārthi labhate dhanam // //
analyzed: mokṣa arthī labhate mokṣam dhana arthi labhate dhanam
translated: One who desires liberation obtains liberation, one who desires wealth obtains wealth.

analyzed: vidyā arthi labhate vidyā tarkavidyā karaṇa anvitam
translated: One who desires knowledge obtains knowledge, along with the means of logical knowledge.

original: sahipatirvat sarāsyā chatruhāni prajāyate // //🔽kṣoṇīpatirvaśastasya smareṇa sadṛśo bhetaḥ /
analyzed: sahi patirvat sarāsyā śatru hāni prajāyate 🔽kṣoṇīpatiḥ vaśaḥ tasya smareṇa sadṛśaḥ
translated: If one recites it four times, one becomes like Indra, the enemy is destroyed.🔽If one recites it five times, one becomes like the king of the earth, one becomes like Indra.

original: yaḥ paṭhet sarvadā bhaktyā śrīyukto bhavati priye // //
analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet sarvadā bhaktyā śrī yuktaḥ bhavati priye
translated: O Beloved, he who always recites this with devotion becomes endowed with prosperity.

analyzed: gaṇādhyakṣya pratinidhiḥ kaviḥ kāvyaḥ iva aparaḥ
translated: The representative of the chief of the Ganas, like another poet in poetry,

analyzed: prayatnena jananī jāra vat sadā
translated: Should be kept secret with effort, like a mother's paramour at all times.

original: hetu yuktā bhaven nityaṃ śaktiyuktaḥ sadā bhavet /
analyzed: yuktā bhavet nityam śakti yuktaḥ sadā bhavet
translated: He should always be endowed with reason and always endowed with power.

original: yaḥ idaṃ paṭhate nityaṃ śivena sarvaśo bhavet // //
analyzed: yaḥ idam paṭhate nityam śivena sarvaśas bhavet  /
translated: He who always recites this becomes everything with Shiva.

analyzed: jīva dharma artha bhogi syāt mṛtaḥ mokṣa patiḥ bhavet
translated: He would be the enjoyer of the dharma, artha and bhoga of life, and after death, he would become the lord of liberation.

original: satyaṃ satyaṃ mahādevī satyaṃ satyaṃ maheśvarī // //
analyzed: satyam satyam mahādevī satyam satyam maheśvarī
translated: It is true, O Great Goddess, it is true, O Great Mistress, it is true, it is true.

original: tavastastya prabhāvena devena sahamodate /🔽stambhitāścāsurāssarve stavarājasya kīrttanām // //🔽iti śrīutkaṇṭhāt saṃvatsare nāgendraprayāṇatantre ṣoḍaśasāhasre
analyzed: tavastastya prabhāvena devena sahamodate  stambhitāḥ ca asurāḥ sarve stavarājasya kīrttanām  iti śrī utkaṇṭhāt saṃvatsare nāga indra prayāṇa tantre ṣoḍaśa sāhasre
translated: By the power of your truth, he rejoices with the Lord.🔽All the demons are paralyzed by the recitation of the King of Hymns.

analyzed: viṣṇu śaṃkara saṃvāde pitāmvara sahasranāma stotram
translated: Thus ends the thousand names of Pitambara, in the dialogue between Vishnu and Shankara, in the sixteen thousand chapters of the Uttara Kanda of the Ramayana.

analyzed: pīta amvara parīdhānām pīta gandha anulepinā
translated: The one who is clad in yellow garments, who is anointed with yellow fragrances,

analyzed: syāt surasundarī
translated: The one who brings about supreme prosperity, the beautiful goddess, by reciting this.

analyzed: atha pītāṃvarā stotram
translated: Now, the hymn to Pitambara.

analyzed: śrī pitāmvarāyai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Shri Pitambara.

analyzed: oṃkārasya dvaya saṃpuṭī itara paṭam
translated: The two-fold covering of the syllable Om, with the two veins of Maya,

analyzed: tad madhye vimalam samvodhanam sarvatas
translated: In the middle of that, the pure invocation, the throat and face, all around.

original: tuṣṭā nāmapi vā ca māśucamukhaṃ sastaṃvayetyakṣaraṃ
analyzed: tuṣṭāḥ vā ca mā aśuca mukham
translated: The syllable tuṣṭā or mā śucā mukhaṃ sa stambhaya,

original: jihvāṃ kīlayaṃ kalayeti ca likhed vuddhiṃ tathā nāśayaḥ // //
analyzed: jihvām kīlayam kalaya iti ca likhet vuddhim tathā na āśayaḥ
translated: One should write jihvāṃ kīlaya kalaya and buddhiṃ tathā nāśaya.
The Brahma weapon, which generates the accomplishment of all goals, with thirty-six syllables,

analyzed: proktam padmabhuvā yatra āradāge purā
translated: Was spoken by the Lotus-born One, for the victory of the world, in the past, where the tongue is.

original: jīvaṃ muktipade vibhāṃ tisradhīyo yeṣāṃ mukhe bhāsate
analyzed: jīvam mukti pade vibhām tisradhīyaḥ yeṣām mukhe bhāsate
translated: Those whose face shines with the three syllables ji-va-mukti-pada-vibhā,

analyzed: tiḥ dvaṃdva amṛta sāgara indu kiraṇāḥ hārāḥ cakorāḥ tu te
translated: May the necklaces of the cakoras be the rays of the moon in the ocean of nectar of the pairs of eyes.

original: drormityādi svarūpaṃ jayati tva śive śabdatanmātragarbhā
analyzed: svarūpam jayati śive śabda tanmātra garbhā
translated: The form beginning with dro conquers, O Śivā, filled with the sound-tanmātra,

original: vāco yasmāt parārthaṃ prakaṭitapaṭavarṇarūpā niripra brahmādyaiḥ /
analyzed: vācaḥ yasmāt para artham prakaṭita paṭa varṇa rūpā brahma ādyaiḥ
translated: From which the speech, in the form of the manifest letters, is for the sake of others, devoid of impurities,

analyzed: paṃcatattvaiḥ api śritam anagham cit pravodha ādi gamyam durjñeyam yoga yukteḥ
translated: Resorted to by Brahmā and others, sinless, to be known through the awakening of consciousness, difficult to know,

analyzed: katham api manasā yogibhi gṭahyamānam
translated: By the union of yoga, somehow grasped by the yogis with the mind.

original: hrī/ vījaṃ hṛdi yasya bhāti vimale lakṣmī sthirā tad gṛhai
analyzed: hrī vījam hṛdi yasya bhāti vimale lakṣmī sthirā tat
translated: In whose heart shines the pure seed of modesty, there Lakshmi (goddess of wealth) remains firm in his house.

original: dhairyaṃ tasya kalavarepi bhajate dīrgho yuṣo bhūtale /
analyzed: dhairyam tasya kalavare pi bhajate dīrghaḥ bhū tale
translated: Even in a young man, his courage remains steady on the earth for a long time.

analyzed: vṛddhim eti vimalā tat vaṃśavallītarā
translated: Even today, his pure family tree grows and prospers.

original: śauryasthairyamupaiti tasya purastasyanti vādhi carāḥ // //🔽vadhucāridhimudyato janakajā nāthopi pītāṃvare tvāṃ🔽dhyātvā navaśoṣaṇe kṛtam itissetuṃ pracakre bhṛśanti /
analyzed: śaurya sthairyam upaiti tasya puras tasyanti vā adhi carāḥ    vadhu cāridhim udyataḥ janakajāḥ nāthaḥ upi pītām vare tvām  dhyātvā nava śoṣaṇe kṛtam itiḥ setum pracakre bhṛśanti
translated: His heroism and firmness are attained, and the moving stars shine in front of him.🔽The daughter of Janaka, Sita, was carried away by Ravana, the king of demons, while her husband Rama was wearing yellow garments.🔽Thinking of you, she made a strong bridge over the ocean to cross it.

analyzed: jitvā āravaṇam ugraśatrum avalān vandīm uvya amarāj
translated: Having conquered Ravana, the fierce enemy, and having brought back Sita, the king of gods

original: kīrttilokasukhodayāṃ vyara ca yat kalpasthirāmaṃvike // //🔽śīrṣikharvati raṃkati kṣitirmūkāyate vāk pati
analyzed: kīrtti loka sukha udayām ca yat kalpa sthirām aṃvike  śīrṣi kharvati raṃkati kṣitiḥ mūkāyate vāc pati
translated: composed this hymn, which brings about the rise of fame, heaven, and happiness, and which remains for as long as the world exists.

analyzed: vahni śītatī durjjanaḥ sujanate puṣpāyate vāsuki
translated: When the earth is covered with dust, speech becomes dumb, the fire becomes cold, the wicked become good, and Vasuki becomes a flower,

analyzed: tava akṣara padaiḥ yantrī kṛtā
translated: when the world is united with your imperishable feet, which are always full of Lakshmi,

analyzed: yantritāḥ patati mukuṭaḥ ced rārka tulyāḥ api
translated: if the crowns of the gods fall down, even though they are equal to the sun,

original: lāvaṇyā mṛtapūrite tava kṛpā yāṅgani magnā nari
analyzed: lāvaṇyā mṛta pūrite tava kṛpā yā aṅgani magnā nari
translated: O you who are filled with beauty, the compassion that is immersed in your limbs in men,

analyzed: brahma indra ādi digīśa bhūtam api te jānanti muṃja upamam
translated: Even the lords of the directions like Brahma and Indra know you to be like a piece of Munja grass.

original: yeṣāṃ cetasi sasthitā śivagale te viśvarakṣā kṣamā🔽prālabdhaṃ dṛḍhayanti satvārataraṃ vighnairavighni kṛtā // //🔽mukhyatvaṃ samupaiti saṃsadi tavā pāṅgāvalokanaraḥ
analyzed: yeṣām cetasi sasthitā śiva gale te viśva rakṣā kṣamā  prālabdham dṛḍhayanti satvārataram vighnaiḥ avighni kṛtā  mukhya tvam samupaiti saṃsadi tavā pāṅga avalokana raḥ
translated: Those in whose mind is present the protection of the universe, which is established in Shiva's throat,🔽They firmly establish the extremely tender attainment, which is not obstructed by obstacles.🔽In the assembly, the mere glance of yours attains preeminence.

analyzed: prabhavate
translated: How wonderful it is that you yourself create the path of creation and destroy it.

original: yaccintena bhāti māmaka iti tvarddarśanaṃ yasya vāte
analyzed: yad cintena bhāti māmakaḥ iti yasya vāte
translated: That which shines in the mind as 'mine', or that which is seen as 'mine',

analyzed: sarva hi aṇima ādayaḥ api atirāmā ārādhayante dhruvam
translated: All the powers like lightness and others certainly worship you excessively.

original: khinnānāṃ varadāyinī jalanidha yo tasthito nāvikāṃ
analyzed: khinnānām vara dāyinī tasthitaḥ nāvikām
translated: O ocean, you who give boons to the tired, who stand as a boat,

analyzed: tatra āsthā ghana kuṇḍa gahvara giri vyāghra ādi bhīteṣu api
translated: There, even to those who are afraid of dense pits, caves, mountains, tigers, etc.

original: tvāṃ pītāṃvaradhāriṇīṃ paraśivāṃ candrāvaṇo🔽dyaḍgadā hastāṃ vāmakare pratiparasanāmunmūlayanti bhaje // //
analyzed: tvām pītām vara dhāriṇīm para śivām candrāvaṇo  hastām vāma kare unmūlayanti bhaje  /
translated: I worship you, who wear yellow garments, who are the supreme auspicious one, who have the moon as your crest-jewel,🔽who hold a conch, discus, mace in your hands, and with your left hand uproot the enemies.

original: svechaṃ pe praṇamantti pādayugalaṃ pītāṃvare tāvakaṃ
analyzed: svecham praṇamanti pāda yugalam tāvakam
translated: They freely bow at your feet, which are covered with yellow garments,

analyzed: te siddhim bhajate punar
translated: Having obtained all the accomplishments more than desired, they again worship you.

original: yat tat kartṛmucī karoti vagale tvat sāṃdhakotrā dhunā
analyzed: yat tat kartṛmucī karoti vagale tvat sāṃdha kotrā dhunā
translated: O Vagale, when you perform that rite which is free from agents,

analyzed: tat saṃjñātam iva īkṣate tava kapāpa aṅga avaloka īkṣaṇam
translated: Your glance, O Kapālinī, is seen as if it has that name.

analyzed: vāṇīm mūkti sudhā rasa drava mayī sā alaṃkṛtā tad mukhe
translated: That speech, full of the essence of the nectar of liberation, is adorned on her face,
Following the curse, it is the sole cause of delight for the poets.

analyzed: vyākaṃrtu kṣamate viśāla mati yān tvat sevakaḥ
translated: Those who are capable of explaining that vast intellect, your servant in speech,

analyzed: kiṃcid tam yadi śṛṣṭim āsuḥ acate brahmāṇḍa koṭi ālaye
translated: If he composes even a little, it is as if Brahma's abode is created in a crore of universes.

analyzed: devi hinagiri mukhaḥ parvatāḥ pāṃśu tulyā
translated: O Goddess, the mountains, with their peaks shattered by the thunderbolt of your devotion, become like dust.

original: kālā mālāśca candrāmṛtakarasadṛśāḥ puṣpatāyāṃ nnināgā /🔽mūkatvaṃ vāk patindrāḥ sarasisamatulāmāśrayante
analyzed: kālāḥ mālāḥ ca candra amṛtakara sadṛśāḥ puṣpa tāyām  mūka tvam vāc pati indrāḥ sarasi sama tulām āśrayante
translated: Time, garlands, and the moon become like nectar-producing flowers.🔽The lords of speech, the gods of speech, attain a matchless state of eloquence.

original: samudrā rājā noraṃkabhāvaṃ raṇa tu viripavo vidravate visastā // //
analyzed: samudrāḥ rājā tu viripavaḥ vidravate visastā
translated: The oceans become like a boat, and the enemies flee in all directions.

analyzed: mantra vījam amalam duṣṭa ogha saṃstabhana vaśyā ākarṣaṇā
translated: Having seen the pure mantra seed, which paralyzes hordes of evil spirits, subjugates, attracts,

analyzed: māraṇa prathamana prakṣobhana ucāṭane
translated: Kills, agitates, and banishes,

analyzed: vyaktam vajam iva padam hṛdimukhe jāgarttimasya agrateḥ
translated: The clear thunderbolt-like word awakens in the heart and face of the enemy.

analyzed: pādāḥ tāḥ saptadvīpā īśvarā
translated: The feet of which are the seven continents, the enemies that wander around.

analyzed: nānā ratna vibhūṣita amala maṇi dvīpe sudhā sāgare
translated: On an island adorned with various jewels, in the pure ocean,

original: kalpānau kṛ hṛkānanāntaragatā yā ratnadevī para /
analyzed: yā
translated: The goddess of jewels who resides in the midst of the forest of kalpas,

analyzed: tantra kārita paṃca preta kamale siṃhāsane saṃsthitām
translated: I meditate on the goddess who grants all desired objects, who is seated on a lion throne in the middle of a lotus with five corpses created by the tantra,

analyzed: dhyāya iham karuṇā ākarām hari harām rādhyām aśaṣa artha dām
translated: who is the source of compassion, who surpasses Hari and Hara.

original: vāgdevi vadane va satyaviratantre ca lakṣmikared
analyzed: vāgdevi vadane ca
translated: O Goddess of Speech, may the Goddess of Speech always reside in your mouth, and Lakshmi in your hands,

original: ānandā nakṛpācutā ca hṛdi ca vīratvamājau sadā /
analyzed: ānandā na kṛpā cutā ca hṛdi ca vīra tvam ājau sadā
translated: joy and compassion in your heart, and heroism in battle.

analyzed: tvat bhaktasya bhava adhvi pāra taraṇe tattva udayaḥ jāyate
translated: For a devotee of yours, the rise of truth occurs in crossing over to the other shore of worldly existence,

original: ye nedaṃ nalini dalo parijalākāraṃ jagaddhāsane // //
analyzed: ye na idam nalini pari jala ākāram jagat hāsane
translated: O lotus-eyed one, who does not consider this world, which is like a gathering of people, as a seat of laughter.

analyzed: pīta vasanām candra avataṃsa ujvalām
translated: I meditate on you, who are yellow-robed like gold, radiant with a moon-crest,

analyzed: keyūrāt gada hāra kuṇḍala dharām bhakta udayaḥ
translated: wearing armlets, a necklace, and earrings, who are devoted to the rise of devotees,🔽with four arms, three eyes, a fierce tongue,

original: tvāṃ dhyāyāmi catubhujāṃ trinayanāmugrāsya jihvāṃ🔽kurākarṣatī mahimaṃ va pā hi ca gale trāṇaṃ tvame vā sime // //
analyzed: tvām dhyāyāmi catu bhujām tri nayanām ugra asya jihvām 🔽mahimam hi ca gale trāṇam tvame vā sime
translated: pulling on your throat, you are my refuge.

analyzed: mātar te mahimānam ugram adhikam proktam svayam
translated: O Mother, if your great and fierce glory can be known by human words, whether through effort or not,

original: mānavairvākyai saktite śrameṇa yadi vā śakyāguṇāṃ bhodhe /
analyzed: mānavaiḥ vākyaiḥ śrameṇa yadi vā bhodhe
translated: and if your qualities can be understood,

original: noti śeṣatayā mururaividiśā tasya padmālaye tasyāt
analyzed: tasya tasya
translated: then may that be accomplished by the lotus-born one, the son of Brahma, in the abode of the lotus.

original: sarvagatā tvameva sadasada sadrūpā sadā gīyate // //
analyzed: sarva gatā tvam eva sat asada sat rūpā sadā gīyate
translated: You alone, all-pervading, are always sung as existing and not existing, as the form of existence.

original: khajantārkṣa samodyasaṃ prakurute tākṣaṃ ca khaṃjādhikaṃ
analyzed: prakurute tākṣam ca khaṃja adhikam
translated: The wind, equal to the lame bird, makes the lame one equal to the bird,

original: vātastaṃbhaya te jalāgni śayane yā vyaktiśaktiḥ śiveḥ /
analyzed: te jala agni śayane yā vyakti śaktiḥ śiveḥ
translated: and the power of manifestation of Shiva, who is the abode of water, fire, and wind,

analyzed: tad vījam vagala iti mastu lasanā lagnam sadā eva amalam
translated: that seed is called Vāgīśā, always attached, pure,

analyzed: yam brahma ādika dūrllabham tu vitalaiḥ
translated: which is difficult to obtain by Brahmā and others, but is easily obtained by those with good fortune.

analyzed: staṃbha tvam pavanaḥ upi
translated: Even the wind becomes paralyzed by the mere sight of the yellow-robed one,

original: kicit taṃ yadi vāridhiḥ ṅālapadaṃ merūstu māṣāmayaḥ /🔽kalpanau kahakāmadhanupramukhai ratnairaliṃda sthitair
analyzed: kicid tam yadi vāridhiḥ ṅāla padam merūḥ tu māṣa āmayaḥ  kalpanau ratnaiḥ aliṃda sthitaiḥ
translated: if the ocean were to say something, Mount Meru would become as light as a bean.

analyzed: vādya argha adhika dānam āśu karute dīne svadīne su api
translated: The poor one, who is always poor, quickly makes offerings of music, worship, and more, to the jewels such as the wish-fulfilling gem and others that are situated in the courtyard.

analyzed: bhāgya ādyasya mukhe vibhāti vimalā vidyā ādi śoṣa ādikā
translated: The pure knowledge, which shines on the face of the fortunate one, due to the drying up of ignorance and others,

analyzed: ṣaṣ triṃśadbhiḥ atha uditā vahu guṇaiḥ vījaiḥ tu sarva artha dā
translated: Then, it is said to be composed of thirty-six parts, with many qualities, and bestows all meanings through the seeds.
